edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.app

Class WapServerConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.web.servlet.config.annotation.WebMvcConfigurationSupport
      • edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.app.WapServerConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextAware, org.springframework.web.context.ServletContextAware

    @Configuration
public class WapServerConfig
extends org.springframework.web.servlet.config.annotation.WebMvcConfigurationSupport
    Contains the configuration and the global constants that affect the entire application.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Matthias Dressel, Michael Hitzker, Markus Hoefler, Andreas Loeffler, Timo Schmidt

    • Field Detail

      • WAP_ENDPOINT_WITHOUT_TRAILING_SLASH

        public static final java.lang.String WAP_ENDPOINT_WITHOUT_TRAILING_SLASH
        The endpoint to use for all requests relating to the Web Annotation Protocol. This version is without the slash "/" at the end

        If no prefix shall be used, which means the root container is the base URL, use a slash "/". Also the endpoint cannot be empty and cannot have white spaces within or before/after.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • WAP_ENDPOINT

        public static final java.lang.String WAP_ENDPOINT
        The endpoint to use for all requests relating to the Web Annotation Protocol. It has to end with a slash "/".

        If no prefix shall be used, which means the root container is the base URL, use a slash "/". Also the endpoint cannot be empty and cannot have white spaces within or before/after.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • applyHttpConfigBeforeSpringInit

        public static void applyHttpConfigBeforeSpringInit()
        This method has to be called before the spring framework is started. The configuration related to the embedded HTTP Server is set to the respective system properties.

      • checkConfig

        public static boolean checkConfig()
        Checks the actual configuration file. Are all paths accessible, is nothing set that contradicts each other and similar tests.
        Returns:
        true if configuration is ok

      • getInstance

        public static WapServerConfig getInstance()
        Returns the single instance of the application configuration. If used in tests or situations where Spring autowiring is not in use the configuration has to be manually updated afterwards.
        Returns:
        The application configuration

        Checks whether the configuration has been initialized (via Spring autowiring or manually). If not, it has to be updated with updateConfig(Properties) prior to usage.
        Returns:
        true if initialized and usable

      • isFallbackValidationActive

        public boolean isFallbackValidationActive()
        Checks whether fallback validation is active. This means on formats for which a specific validator is not implemented, the validation is performed on JSON-ld. This involves format conversion!
        Returns:
        true if fallback validation is active

        Returns:
        true if default profiles will always be added to JSON-LD requests
